rice.description: Rice is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population, especially in Asia.
rice.ideal_weather: Warm and humid climate with consistent rainfall.

maize.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a cereal grain that was first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico.
maize.ideal_weather: Warm temperatures, adequate sunlight, and well-drained soil.

chickpea.description: Chickpea, also known as garbanzo bean, is a legume that is widely grown in many parts of the world.

kidneybeans.description: Kidney beans are a variety of the common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris), a legume native to Central America and Mexico.

pigeonpeas.description: Pigeon peas are a perennial legume from the family Fabaceae. They are drought-resistant and can be grown in semi-arid regions.

mothbeans.description: Moth beans, also known as matki, Turkish gram, or dew bean, are a drought-resistant legume grown mainly in arid and semi-arid regions.
mothbeans.ideal_weather: Warm temperatures and well-drained sandy loam soil.

mungbean.description: Mung beans, also known as green gram, are a type of legume widely cultivated in Asia.

blackgram.description: Black gram, also known as urad dal, is a type of bean grown mainly in South Asia.

lentil.description: Lentils are edible pulses or seeds that belong to the legume family. They are a rich source of protein and are cultivated in many countries around the world.

pomegranate.description: Pomegranate is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub or small tree in the family Lythraceae.
pomegranate.ideal_weather: Semi-arid to arid climates with mild winters.

banana.description: Banana is a tropical fruit that grows on large herbaceous plants of the genus Musa.

mango.description: Mango is a tropical fruit that is native to South Asia but is now grown in many tropical and subtropical regions around the world.

grapes.description: Grapes are fruiting berries of the deciduous woody vines of the botanical genus Vitis.
grapes.ideal_weather: Warm, dry climate with moderate humidity.

watermelon.description: Watermelon is a scrambling and trailing vine in the flowering plant family Cucurbitaceae.

muskmelon.description: Muskmelon, also known as cantaloupe or sweet melon, is a species of melon that belongs to the cucumber family.

apple.description: Apple is the pomaceous fruit of the apple tree, species Malus domestica in the rose family Rosaceae.
apple.ideal_weather: Cool to cold climates with a chilling period.

orange.description: Orange is a citrus fruit that is cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions around the world.

papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit that is native to the Americas but is now cultivated in many tropical and subtropical regions worldwide.

coconut.description: Coconut is a fruit of the coconut palm, Cocos nucifera. It is used for its water, milk, oil, and tasty flesh.
coconut.ideal_weather: Warm, tropical climate with well-distributed rainfall.

cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of the cotton plants of the genus Gossypium.
cotton.ideal_weather: Warm temperatures, plenty of sunshine, and moderate rainfall.

jute.description: Jute is a long, soft, shiny bast fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads. It is produced from plants in the genus Corchorus.
jute.ideal_weather: Warm and wet climate with well-drained soil.

coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
